name: The Farm Carbon Cutting Toolkit
goal:
Farm Carbon Cutting Toolkit started in 2009 as a vehicle for farmers to connect with other farmers to reduce their greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions.

It was started, has been developed, and is run by farmers and aims to encourage the awareness of climate change within the UK farming community and support farmers who understand the importance of taking action to reduce GHG emissions from their farming operations.

It is a not for profit organisation and is underpinned by a lot of voluntary support. All the information and tools on this website are offered free of charge.

FCCT was set up because there was no farmer led organisation to provide practical support for farmers in neither this area nor providing a clear farmer informed platform on the importance and urgency to tackle climate change.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Environment, Research and Technology
euInitiatives: Greenhouse gas emissions from Agriculture and LULUCF
